realtimeweb.businesssearch.main

Class NamedLocation

  • Object
    • realtimeweb.businesssearch.main.NamedLocation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Location

    public class NamedLocation
extends Object
implements Location
    A location specified primarily by an address - usually describing a larger area (such as "Blacksburg, VA"). Optionally, a latitude and longitude can be specified to disambiguate the region (for example, if the address is "Newark", then the latitude and longitude could be given to make it clear that we're talking about the Newark in Delaware and not the one in New Jersey.
    Author:
    acbart

    • Constructor Detail

      • NamedLocation

        public NamedLocation(String address)
        Create a new NamedLocation based on an address. Usually the area described by the address is broad - for example, "Blacksburg, VA" would be a better choice than "1313 Mockingbird Lane, Blacksburg VA".
        Parameters:
        address -

      • NamedLocation

        public NamedLocation(String address,
             double latitudeHint,
             double longitudeHint)
        Create a new NamedLocation based on an address (which usually describes a broad area), and also specifying a latitude and longitude to disambiguate the location. So, for instance, you can use: NamedLocation("Newark", 39, 75) to specify the Newark in Delaware, as opposed to the Newark in New Jersey.
        Parameters:
        address -
        latitudeHint -
        longitudeHint -

    • Method Detail

      • getAddress

        public String getAddress()
        Returns the address specified for this location.
        Returns:

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(String address)
        Sets the address for this location. The address usually describes a broad area, e.g. "Blacksburg VA".
        Parameters:
        address -

      • removeHint

        public void removeHint()
        Removes the latitude/longitude hint for this location. Only the address will be used to specify the area.

      • setHint

        public void setHint(double latitudeHint,
           double longitudeHint)
        Sets a latitude/longitude hint for the address, helping to disambiguate between similarly named areas. So, for instance, if the address was "Newark", specifying a latitude and longitude of (39,75) will specify the Newark in Delaware, as opposed to the Newark in New Jersey.
        Parameters:
        latitudeHint -
        longitudeHint -

        public double getLatitudeHint()
        Returns the latitude that is being used to disambiguate the location.

        Returns:

      • hasHint

        public boolean hasHint()
        Returns whether a latitude and longitude is being used to disambiguate this address.

      • getFilter

        public Map<String,String> getFilter()
        This method is for internal use only. Please ignore it.
        Used to create a dictionary of key-value pairs for this location.
        Specified by:
        getFilter in interface Location
        Returns:
        A mapping between Yelp arguments and the values of the location.
